alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 20 at 4:29AM PST until February 22 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Northwest winds 30 to 45 mph with damaging gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Antelope Valley, Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range, San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands and Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down large objects such as trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles across Interstate 5 as well as Highways 14, 101, and 138. Areas of blowing dust could restrict visibilities to less than a quarter mile in the Antelope Valley. The very strong winds expected across coastal waters will generate dangerous steep seas near the Channel Islands and Catalina Island, capable of capsizing small boats.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range
